result.execSummary:
The defendant Moses Kelly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: If  revoked, defendant to receive credit for 240 days time served

miscConds.notes: Court WAIVED costs, fees and surcharges due to defendant's limited income. Provide a DNA sample; pay DNA surcharge during period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

- Defendant is to be supervised by the Mental Health Unit of the DOC's.
- No use of controlled substances.
- No contact with the victim.
- Participate in Sex Offender Evaluation.
- No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 16 years of age.
- Cooperate with the DOC's and any recommendations for treatment or programming.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Moses Kelly

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Arguments heard as to bail. Court ordered cash bail adjusted down to $250.00 with turnover to Justice Point monitoring. Defendant to provide Justice Point with address and name of the person he would be staying with at the residence. Justice Point MUST speak directly to the person living at the residence and obtain a name, phone number, and address. No children under the age of 16 years are to reside at the residence.

Defendant Moses Kelly in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Defendant Moses Kelly in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams on behalf of Erin Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. 
Defendant sworn in. 
As to COUNT 1:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Discussion regarding defendant's residence. Case adjourned to Branch 25. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Invoice forwarded to accounts payable in the amount of $281.25 to Dr.Collins for services on 10-14-14, 10-21-14, 10-23-14. Copy in File.

Defendant Moses Kelly in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Defendant Moses Kelly in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy on behalf of Erin Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for return on doctor's report. State and defense are not challenging the competency report. Court will endorse findings of Dr. Collins and finds the defendant competent to proceed. Defense needs additional time to review the NGI report with the defendant. Court will defer a ruling on the NGI doctor's report until the next court date. Defense counsel requests a projected plea date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Doctor's Report relative to defendant's mental responsibility received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Doctor's report relative to defendant's competency to proceed in this case received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Moses Kelly in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Defendant Moses Kelly in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Parties are prepared to proceed. Defendant sworn in. During plea colloquy, defense counsel raised competency concerns. Defense requests an NGI evaluation and a competency evaluation be completed. State does not object. Order for Competency Evaluation and Order for Examination under 971.16 signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Moses Kelly in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Defendant Moses Kelly in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Defense counsel requests projected plea date. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 9/24/14. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Substantive jury instructions filed by ADA Karshen received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Witness List received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Proposed verdict forms received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Motion in Limine received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Moses Kelly in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter. Defendant in custody.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Case scheduled for plea hearing.  Defense has not received the DNA results.  Defense request a jury trial at this time.  Parties advised this matter will be reassigned to Judge Konkol. Br 44 in room 506 of the Safety Building as of August 1, 2014.   Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Rothstein, Br. 25.  Case set for final pretrial on 8/28/2014 at 8:30 am.  Jury trial set for 9/24/14 at 9:00 am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br 25.

Defendant Moses Kelly in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Moses Kelly in custody.  Paul L Tiffin on behalf of Erin Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Defense was provided with a request report.  DNA testing is still being conducted.  Defense believes this matter will resolve once the DNA results are received.  Court scheduled the matter for a plea.   Case is adjourned to Br 12.  Plea hearing scheduled for 07-11-2014 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Introduce DNA Evidence received and filed.
Notice of Expert Testimony received and filed.

Attorney Richard J Carpenter in court, defendant Moses Kelly not in court, in custody.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Defense has received discovery and an offer but needs additional time to review the offer with the defendant.  Defense believes this matter will resolve prior to trial.   Case is adjourned to Br 12.  Further proceedings scheduled for 06-18-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Moses Kelly in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Moses Kelly in custody.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Branch 12, Judge David Borowski presiding.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with E.D.C. (DOB:  11/17/1999), David B. and Autumn W.

Defendant Moses Kelly in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Moses Kelly in custody.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   
DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
